FuncDef: The reset pki all-cert command deletes all local certificates and CA certificates from the memory.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The reset pki all-cert command is applicable to the following scenarios:
When a certificate expires (the validity of a license is generally 10 years) or the key of the certificate is disclosed, run the reset pki all-cert command to delete all certificates and apply for a new certificate.When the pki delete-certificate command is used to delete specified CA certificates or local certificates from the memory, the system searches for corresponding files in the CF card first. If the desired files cannot be found in the CF card, the certificates cannot be deleted as expected. In such case, run the reset pki all-cert command to delete all certificates.
